election_record.label: Pennsylvania 1822 U.S. House of Representatives, District 1, Special

overview.note: Thomas Forrest was elected on October 1, 1822, in the first district, to the Seventeenth Congress, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of William Milnor and served from October 8, 1822 to March 3, 1823.
"Col. Forrest is therefore elected by a majority of ONE vote." Lancaster Intelligencer (Lancaster, PA). October 19, 1822.

sub_unit.name: One
sub_unit.note: Early editions of several newspaper sources report different vote counts in Philadelphia City and County, but in subsequent editions those same sources report the same vote counts as do other sources.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Pennsylvania State Archives, Harrisburg.
